task.timer.model

Class ManageEntity<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • task.timer.model.ManageEntity<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the generic type of AbstractEntity
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEntityManager

    public class ManageEntity<T>
extends Object
implements IEntityManager
    This class implements a persistent Data Access Objects that allows for a machine-friendly interaction with the database.

    It facilitates standard database table interactions (add/delete/update/list) as well as adds some utilility functions.

    All the operations are performed on AbstractEntity supertype, which allows for generic handling of all database entities. All supported entities extend from an abstract layer AbstractEntity.

    Specific ManageEntities are defined at construction time using EntityType.

    A ManageEnity instance will accept an existing SessionFactory or create it's own at construction.

    Since:
    JDK 1.8
    Author:
    Mateusz Trybulec

      • add

        Adds a record to the database of EntityType defined at instantiation. Will ping the database before performing the operation.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

        Specified by:
        update in interface IEntityManager
        Parameters:
        newEntity - the updated entity. The id must match the id of the entity to be updated in the database.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if class for given EntityType cannot be found.

      • list

        public List<AbstractEntity> list()
        Returns all the entities of defined EntityType.

        When implemented for specific classes implementing AbstractEntity, members of the list need to be cast to the target sub-class Will ping the database before performing the operation.

        Specified by:
        list in interface IEntityManager
        Returns:
        the list of AbstractEntity.

        public User getUserForLogin(String login)
        Gets the user for a specific login. Will ping the database before performing the operation.
        Parameters:
        login - the searched login.
        Returns:
        the User for specified login or null if User not found.

      • listRecordsForDateRange

                                            String dateEnd)

        dateEnd - the search end date
        Returns:
        the list of records.

      • listRecords

        public List<Record> listRecords(User user,
                                Project project,
                                LocalDate date)
        Lists records for a given user and/or project and/or specific date.

        When parameter passed as null, it is treated as optional, i.e. all are returned. Example: a null for a user will return records for all the users.

        Will ping the database before performing the operation.

        Parameters:
        user - the user
        project - the project
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the list of records.

      • listRecords

        public List<Record> listRecords(User user,
                                Project project,
                                LocalDate dateStart,
                                LocalDate dateEnd)
        Lists records for a given user and/or project and/or specific date range.

        When parameter passed as null, it is treated as optional, i.e. all are returned. Example: a null for a user will return records for all the users.

        Will ping the database before performing the operation.

        Parameters:
        user - the user
        project - the project
        dateStart - the search start date.
        dateEnd - the search end date.
        Returns:
        the list of records.

      • ping

        Ping the database using the ping url from the SessionFactory configuration file.

        Parameters:
